intro: Mortonia palmeri, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments with minimal water availability. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Mortonia palmeri plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
